column4: what is the best supported video card on ubuntu (preferably some of the newer ones)?
It depends on who you ask. I'd say Nvidia if you want halfway decent 3d performance too.
how about the nvidia 8600 XFX gt?
With the driver from Envy or the restricted driver.
I have an ati card. But I have had trouble with it since .. well .. a long time.
are there any benchmarks for different nvidia cards on ubuntu?
Generally you can use the windows benchmarks and simply subtract x% in performance. The relative performance should be the same since they're unified drivers, mostly.
No no! Don't quote me but I'd say 10-20%
I get that much back in my mem and CPU performance so its an okay trade
